I used to have a really thick head of hair, and recently have been losing it more in the shower and while brushing. I was given a promotional code to buy the product on Amazon and paid $10 to review it with the caveat that I not post anything other than a five-star review. With the second assignment I was given, I was encouraged (twice) to go ahead and rate the product as soon as I'd purchased it without waiting until I'd actually received it, never mind tried. The third product I was asked to review was Ultrax Labs Hair Rush DHT Blocking Hair Loss Maxx Hair Growth Nutrient Solubilized Keratin Vitamin Supplement and for this assignment I was explicitly instructed to not buy the product at all, to just write the review. Apparently, $10 is enough to buy most people's integrity, but when I read the negative reviews of Ultrax Labs Hair Rush DHT Blocking Hair Loss Maxx Hair Growth Nutrient Solubilized Keratin Vitamin Supplement from people who'd been ripped off, I could not do what was being asked of me, which was to outright LIE.

  717. The ingredients in this product are associated with healthy hair. Keratin is the protein that covers the hair shaft. Other ingredients in this product, including magnesium, zinc and Vitamin B6 are essential for healthy hair. Zinc deficiency is associated with hair loss. Pumpkin seed powder, a source of zinc, is also one of the ingredients in this supplement. Saw palmetto, another active ingredient, acts as an antiandrogen; excess androgen can cause hair loss.This product has a solid combination of ingredients needed for hair growth.

  829. As a health care professional, I was extremely skeptical when I ordered this product. In my mind, the ratings were almost too good for something that literally isn't regulated by the FDA. However, after taking this supplement for a month or so now, I do feel as though I see a noticeable difference, though I can't be sure if this is placebo effect or not. Keep in mind, that if this product did possess the ability to inhibit dihydrotestosterone (DHT, the active form of testosterone), there can be side effects, such as loss in sexual desire and impotence, just like with finasteride, a prescription DHT antagonist that actually works, an is utilized for male pattern baldness. Would I ever recommend this to a patient in a health care setting? It depends on what they have tried in the past, and to what effect. However, as a young practitioner who wants to maintain his full head of hair without using rogaine (works, but can cause transient hair loss in many), sure, I gave it a shot. At the very least, it is something to keep on the forever growing list of supplements to consider when your hair seems thinner.

  1213. This is a miracle product! Ultrax Labs Hair Maxx formula includes over twenty essential vitamins, minerals and herbs; which combine to form a powerhouse of hair loss prevention and growth acceleration. The Ultrax Labs Hair Maxx supplement blocks DHT production, which is what causes hair to fall out of the follicle. Saw palmetto blocks the 5 alpha reductase enzyme, which facilitates the change of testosterone into DHT. Nettle leaf powder blocks DHT directly. This two-pronged approach to blocking DHT with saw palmetto and nettle leaf powder is what makes Ultrax Labs Hair Maxx so effective. In addition to saw palmetto and nettle leaf powder, the Hair Maxx formula includes solubilized keratin which accelerates hair growth, increases hair thickness, and decreases hair loss. Hair Maxx also includes pumpkin seed powder to promote faster and healthier hair growth; as well as biotin, zinc, vitamin B6, and magnesium, which are follicle boosters. Ultrax Labs Hair Maxx is highly effective for both men and women, and there are no side effects. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone with baldness or thinning hair.
